user_questions.text: Why are we having to make all these new db elements, shouldn't we already have most of it all there?
don't we already have columns for all that? we don't need responses probably
why does the shared values card have the friend memory story capture element, isn't it just supposed to show the value?

user_statements.text: Why are we having to make all these new db elements, shouldn't we already have most of it all there?
don't we already have columns for all that? we don't need responses probably
isn't it just supposed to show the value?

documents_provided.description: Multiple database column errors and React component errors
Complete codebase with schema and component files

concepts.name: Values Card
concepts.definition: Core data structure storing meaningful moments, identified values, and future intentions

concepts.name: Friend Perspectives
concepts.definition: Feature allowing friends to share observations about user's values

values.name: Low Tolerance for Unexpected Complexity
evidence: Expresses frustration with missing database elements
quotes: Why are we having to make all these new db elements, shouldn't we already have most of it all there?

tensions.description: Application code assumes database schema that doesn't match reality
User expects database to already be properly configured

beliefs: Database should already have all necessary schema from previous work
Redundancy should be eliminated from architecture
Shared cards should show only core values, not all features
Complete rewrites are better than incremental patches when things are messy

conversation_clustering.relationship_to_other_conversations: Same day as values conversation, continuation of reflection tool development

project_activity.project_phase: Late afternoon debugging session after morning/midday usage

for_instance_1_origins: When was the values_cards database schema originally created?
Was there a previous version of this app with a different data model?
Has Bilal encountered schema mismatch issues before?
for_instance_2_outcomes: Did Bilal successfully resolve all the database schema errors?
Did the simplified schema (without responses field) work better?
Did Bilal create a proper database migration system after this?

notes: Technical debugging session showing Bilal's frustration with schema mismatches and strong preference for simplicity. Actively questions and removes architectural redundancy. Shows different communication style under stress - very terse, direct. Maintains product clarity even during technical work by questioning feature scope.
